column4: I wanna check whether the linux bluetooth protocol stack is installed on my machine or not, how can I do that ?
check the output of "dmesg" to see if there are any mentions of bluetooth
yes there is
it is in your home directory
but files beginning with a . do not show up by default, though it is there
you need to add an entry to /etc/fstab
the entry is present in fstab
then it should mount at boot, unless you have "noauto" in the options
there is no noauto in the options
it says back : mount: wrong fs type, bad option, bad superblock on /dev/hda4, missing codepage or other error In some cases useful info is found in syslog - try dmesg | tail  or so
did you put the right filesystem type in /etc/fstab?
you need the same options in fstab as you pass to "mount" on the command line
my fstab http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/19006
if it really is ext3, try removing the "utf8" bit, i think that is not needed on ext3 filesystems
in fact, remove the umask and gid parts as well so the options just say "defaults"
you mean /dev/hda4       /media/hda4     ext3    defaults  0       1
yes
I did mount -a and it has opened up my drive
I hope it would do it on restart as well
ok, that should be automounted next time you reboot
